definitions.definition: a large flow of blood from a damaged blood vessel (= tube carrying blood around the body):
an escape of blood from any blood vessel:
examples: Serious haemorrhage may occur at any time throughout pregnancy.
The higher salaries paid overseas have caused a haemorrhage of talent from this country.

definitions.definition: to lose a large amount of blood in a short time:
examples: She started haemorrhaging while giving birth to the baby.

definitions.definition: to lose large amounts of something such as money over a period of time and be unable to stop this happening:
examples: The business has been haemorrhaging money for several months.
